subject: Productivity
title: Dopamine and Task Initiation
description: One-minute skill: Dopamine and Task Initiation.

hook.text: Starting a task is harder than continuing it. Dopamine explains why.

buildup.text: Dopamine is needed to initiate action. Low dopamine makes even simple tasks feel monumental.

discovery.text: Social media provides easy dopamine hits. The brain then struggles to start less rewarding tasks.

twist.text: This isn't about willpower. It's neurochemistry. The brain chases the easiest dopamine source available.

climax.text: Reducing easy dopamine sources before work makes productive tasks feel more rewarding by contrast.

punchline.text: Make the hard task the easiest dopamine hit available.

quiz.question: Why does social media make it harder to start productive tasks?
options: It provides easy dopamine that makes other tasks feel less rewarding
It takes up all available time
